info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Spartanburg, western Cherokee and northwestern Union Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Spartanburg, or near Croft State Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Spartanburg, Pacolet, Cowpens, Mayo, Pacolet Mills, Cowpens National Battlefield, Croft State Park, Cedar Springs and Pauline. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
